awd_titl_txt: Measurement of Strength-Related Micro-Stress Distribution   in Fiber/Matrix/Interphase Systems
awd_abstract_narration: The objectives of this research are to validate current and                     proposed composite micromechanical models by direct experimental                measurements and to determine the resulting stress state near                   damaged regions in materials subjected to tensile, compressive, and             bending loads.  This will be accomplished with a unique test                    methodology which employs a geometrically scaled up version of an               polymeric composite containing embedded sensors.  These sensors                 provide a direct and systematic approach to measure strain                      redistribution in a material and provides previously unobtainable               baseline data which are essential in validating existing models and             developing new ones.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
